Message.Title: IBM Technical Weakness
Message.Msg: IBM hasn't had the 50 day MA cross down over the 200 day MA and the 200 day EMA since 2008 when the market as a whole tanked. If IBM were to report revenue growing weaker for Q4 it may prompt selling. I'm on the sidelines with IBM and waiting for an entry point -- scared off by the fiscal cliff and the death cross. At this point I expect weakness in the EU to show up in IBM's income statement in Q4

Message.Title: IBM's disservice to its shareholders
Message.Msg: Failure to pay a special dividend to its shareholders before 2013 is detrimental to IBM's shareholders. The board of directors should be held accountable (sued).
election day is over, shareholders had their chance to sell. you cannot hold the board responsible for obama administration tax policies which were clearly reported, discussed and cheered by media.

"Failure to pay a special dividend to its shareholders before 2013 is detrimental to IBM's shareholders. The board of directors should be held accountable (sued)." That's ridiculous -- IBM is not controlled by large individual shareholders like Oracle or Costco. The IBM BOD is under no obligation to declare a special dividend -- or for that matter the BOD doesn't have to declare any dividend -- it's up to a vote at each quarterly BOD meeting.

IBM has been weak since it sliced its 50 DMA in heavy volume on October 17! The stock was down more than $10 that day and has never regained strength, even during the most recent uptrend. There is way too much political news moving the markets. I advise all mom and pop traders to get out. All major averages are below critical technical levels. The markets are going lower...

Topic.Title: IBM latest pension cut hits older employees hardest.....again.

Message.Msg: IF you can retire....if you are not eligible, you are getting the shaft. What about the people in the sweet spot 25-30 years, still on defined contribution plan, and relying on the 401k bump to get them closer to even. Most of those folks saw a 33% pension cut 4 years ago.

Topic.Title: IBM latest pension cut hits older employees hardest.....again.

Message.Msg: If you quit you will lose part of your last year Co. match. BFD you are then moving to greener pastures and are of no remaining value to the Co.or stockholders.
